page.title: 02S.W.GUILDFORD:LOSELEY PARK
page.content: Loseley Park is a historic home built in the Elizabethan period from 1562 to 1568 by Sir William More. The house has not changed throughout the centuries but within there have been gradual additions of furniture, books and paintings from each succeeding generation. Some of the more famous portraits are of Elizabeth I and James I. The family of the More Molyneuxs still live at Loseley and farm 1000 acres. The land is used for dairy cattle and the Jersey herd's milk eventually produces yoghurt, cream and ice-cream. This produce is sold throughout the surrounding area. Fruit and vegetables are available from the farm shop. In spite of the farm's lucrative business, Loseley Park retains its aura of history.
